means: （英国议会中的）前座议员（政府大臣或反对党领袖）

entry.def: In Britain, a frontbencher is a member of Parliament who is a minister in the Government or who holds an official position in an opposition party.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of the House of Commons who is a minister or an ex-minister

auth_sentence.content: "This is an early test case of whether we can take difficult decisions," a frontbencher says.
auth_sentence.res_content: "This is an early test case of whether we can take difficult decisions," a frontbencher says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "This is an early test case of whether we can take difficult decisions," a frontbencher says.
